page.title: 09Health
page.content: The area, typical of many small communities in rural Britain, lacks a great many services and amenities, although rates are lower than in towns. Refuse collection by the Council is now carried out through means of large 1.5 metre high plastic bins which speed up one-weekly collections. There is a small Doctor's practise ( with two G.Ps ) about 4 miles from{Stanford Dingley.}The nearest{hospital}is 10 miles away. There is a{vetinery practice}at{Tutt's {Clump}which serves a wide area. A mobile{Blacksmith}meets the need of the numerous small-time horse owners and commercial stables in the area.
